string.text: {=Dr6ZjtKR}Greetings, wanderer. Might I know where you are from?
{=ZO6PptgQ}Oh, here and there. I'm a recent arrival in Calradia.
{=6Yy1KWgT}Mind your own business, mate.

{=UlsvDHLV}Ah, a pity. If you were a native of Calradia, I would be most interested to know about your ancestry and some particulars of your place of birth. I am collecting notes on the lineages of this land, both of the great imperial families and of our barbarian brethren.

{=KoetJ3P0}I confess I find the barbarians particularly interesting, for they have many virtues that we in the Empire have lost - a certain honesty of spirit, I should say, not our thick stew of civilized intrigues.
{=T8egZl6T}Yes. Please continue.
{=yjkGHRkA}All very interesting to a scholar, I suppose, but not to me. Good day.
{=R0oKayMF}If you are a wanderer, as you say, perhaps it would be to my advantage to go along with you, to collect such stories as I can. I may indeed be able to assist you in some way.
{=EGchHvKa}I've been about, in halls and gers and tents, collecting some fascinating accounts. But I'd still be interested in accompanying you, if you'll have me.
{=OVCdGjpT}Perhaps. What skills do you have to offer?
{=BMKqMpQ7}I'm most interested in the barbarian virtue of sticking axes in skulls. You don't look the type.

{=gQa9XZfG}I can offer you my knowledge of the ancestries of the lords, chieftains, noyans, and other nobility of Calradia, both civilized and savage. You will find that it may please them if you claim to recognize, on first making their acquaintance, the name of their clan, and whether they are called 'The Boneless,' 'Nestbeard,' 'The Scratcher,' or some other charming sobriquet.
{=8HKl3HNH}The one thing I ask - other than food, shelter, and a few denars for pocket expenses, of course - is that I am not party to pillage and slave-taking.
{=hyhYcrFp}Very well. Consider yourself hired.
{=iBHDCIwV}I don't take recruits who impose conditions on me. Good day to you.

{=WzyHzNW3}Splendid, {?PLAYER.GENDER}madame{?}sir{\?}! There is one other small favor. I have incurred a few debts in this town, mostly due to the spilling of wine upon books. I would ask for an advance of {NPCPAYMENT} on my pay.
{=IcBPLx2R}Very well, here's {NPCPAYMENT}{GOLD_ICON}.
{=9w5W46E9}Greetings. I'm looking for warriors, and you look like you might fit the bill.
{=D33fIGQe}Never mind.

{=mk0l1BfB}You might say that. I've served in the empire's legions for two decades. Once upon a time they were worthy of being called 'legions.' We served together for years, the same group of men under a single standard, and we'd die rather than see those standards falter or fall. But Drosios Neretzes led the last of the real legions into an ambush in the Battanian woods. You may have heard that story.

{=rNkwrwo4}I blame Arenicos and his so-called reforms. It saved him silver, but now our armies are just blown-up lords' retinues - toadies, farmers who have no business on the battlefield, a few good men but not enough. There's no pride and no discipline. No wonder that we're squabbling among ourselves these days, being mocked by the barbarians we used to rule.
{=WQCAanal}Ah, the old days. And no doubt back then they complained about the older days. I've heard enough.

{=4dJ0KhjB}But maybe it's for the best. Whoever wins this war will at least be a worth leader of men.... Are you're looking for swords to hire? I'm bored and I'm ready to jump into the game again, and I doubt my wife will miss me much.
{=NLLnv7WH}I've been around and about. I'm still bored. I'm still drinking more than I should.
{=37gFwKgg}I have a band of fighters, and I could use a man with some experience.
{=jIC9xW8W}That's good to hear. Naturally I expect to be compensated in silver for my blood and sweat.

{=n3IEXAGH}In return for that, I promise to do my best to whip whatever sorry rabble you recruit into soldiers. I don't bother with horsemen and I don't bother with bowmen. But give me footmen with a bit of guts, and I'll teach them to stand together in a rock-solid formation that will break any charge you care to throw at it.
{=7qfZbVii}I think I could use a man like you.
{=RZZXKFvd}Actually, I'm more interested in skirmishers.
{=EQSc8FxA}Splendid - about the money. Shall we say an advance of {NPCPAYMENT}{GOLD_ICON}? That's enough for me to know you're serious.
{=IcBPLx2R}Very well, here's {NPCPAYMENT}{GOLD_ICON}.
{=Wnt5Ngzr}Greeting, {?PLAYER.GENDER}madame{?}sir{\?}. Are you by any chance in the market for an engineer?
{=6EeM0jbm}I might be. What do you have to offer?
{=APKQ8HuA}No, I'm not, I'm afraid. Good day to you.

{=a2rWCsZS}I hope you don't mind a little immodesty. If you're building, I'm one of the best you can hire. I can build any arch, any tower, any dome you might want. Every city around here has examples of my craft.

{=plzerw4U}If you're knocking down, I'm not just one of the best - I am the best. I do rams, mines, and of course catapults. Torsion and counterweight. You can ask any castellan in any town in Calradia... Well, maybe best not ask in this town, but any other town in Calradia.
{=OGqp7v0p}I see. What happened here?
{=CKgC2JXg}You do not inspire me with confidence.

{=2MJElaJi}Well, the master of artillery here took the counterweight right on the skull. It was a 5-pound ball, so the counterweight weighed about as much as a small horse. You can imagine what that looked like. So they're not going to pay me - even though the ball, I'm proud to say, threw straight over 500 paces. Even with a bit of muck on it.
{=VC5CkkUD}That's very impressive! From a technical standpoint, that is.
{=j2auwAej}Above all, an engineer must be cautious. Good-day, sir.

{=pgoFlK3o}At any rate, I got out of there when they were still bumbling about with a bucket and mop. But if there's an inquiry and people start looking for someone to blame, well, they'll probably decide to point the finger at the external contractor. So I wouldn't mind getting out of town.

{=QAuX5fN4}Take me on now, and you can have my services for a fraction of what they're worth. Believe me, in your line of work, there's no bigger expense than a lengthy siege. Unless you like drinking dirty water and squatting in muddy ditches, hiring me is an opportunity you can't afford to miss.
{=iwxJWG81}I can't pass up a bargain like that. I'd like to hire you.
{=KUKuUJaL}You try too hard to sell yourself. I guess I'm going to have to say 'no.'.
{=YBtDZuCL}Excellent. I'd like an advance payment, not least because I'm going to need to get my equipment cleanred. Shall we say {NPCPAYMENT}?
{=IcBPLx2R}Very well, here's {NPCPAYMENT}{GOLD_ICON}.
{=MjSlFqAl}Yes? I'll have you know, I'm not normally in the habit of talking to strangers in taverns.
{=30PC7qqc}I find it a good way of picking up useful information.
{=oxNAJ1Ha}In that case, I shall go bother someone else.
{=9vcC9WNE}Ah yes, I suppose it is. Well, if it interests you, my name is Haldaea, and I have resolved to become a warrior.

{=cXKvmJGb}I'm sure it has not escaped you that this empire of ours is in a dreadful state. Men have lost all sense of duty and self-respect, and regularly turn their tail in the face of rebels, barbarians, and other such rabble.
{=Upr8OV6G}Sorry times indeed, madame. Pray continue.
{=vqC3imQv}Rabble? Barbarians? These are my friends you're talking about!

{=xlJEkqH9}I intend to find the captain of a company who will take me on as an apprentice. I will thereupon master the arts of war, and raise a company of my own, and thus shame the males of the empire into recovering their lost manhood.
{=Db8cb8w6}Well, you have the right attitude. I might take you on.
{=v86ZaoFv}I think you are wasting your time, madame. Good day
{=cI8YERnL}If you do so, I promise to always be in the front rank of your battle line, to never shirk duty even in the face of death.
{=Ho8MFOOi} I will ensure that your men fear my scorn more than they do the spears of the enemy.
{=A7ToDPfN}Splendid. That's the spirit. Gather your belongings.
{=hR7mKQPs}Scorn alone does not make men brave, madame. I think you'd best find another captain.

{=K0Eh3eYs}Splendid. I will need a small amount of money in advance - {NPCPAYMENT}{GOLD_ICON}. I have several servants, who have been with our family for years, who cannot accompany me. Honor and basic humanity require that I give them a small amount of money to get on their feet.
{=IcBPLx2R}Very well, here's {NPCPAYMENT}{GOLD_ICON}.
{=awCIaqxG}Ho there. Will you join me in a cup of ale?
{=qrfeidLk}Very well. Here's to your health.
{=C6GmacOA}I am otherwise occupied, sir.
{=8O8jU9Jp}And to your health, both physical and spiritual! And always remember - spiritual health comes only from repentence, and for that you have need of something to repent.

{=gI4xkaaR}I'll grant that's a bit of a heretical notion to the imperial priesthood, but then I was raised a heretic. Perhaps you've heard of the Embers of the Flame? Well, I was born into the retinue of a Perfect, back when the Embers were blazing fire and we wandered the countryside preaching faith and rebellion.
{=TGYJUUn0}Go on.
{=fpQnbafH}This conversation got rather dangerous rather quickly.

{=FkhUMTpJ}I reckon I had a gift for a sermon. We'd wander into a village and I'd cut loose with a speech that would have the villagers selling their lands and joining us on our endless pilgrimage. But you know, I suppose the Perfect got a little jealous, started accusing me of deadly error here and the sin of pride there...

{=QNVJgFbF}It got tiresome, I can tell you, being accused of heresy by a heretic while living on donations by day and hiding in the hedgerows at night lest the local nobility got tired of us coaxing their tenants into holy poverty. I told the Perfect I wished to bring our message to the towns, and he gave me leave to come here, but I reckon I've gone a little bit astray.
{=igGhbdFj}The Heavens lead us where they will. And how do you make your living?
{=eUkVaqJN}A colorful life, I suppose, but of little interest to me. Good day to you.
{=i53bBgar}So, then... I've had odd jobs for the past few years. Mostly I stand in marketplaces shouting out the virtues of this one's saddles or that one's melons...

{=on8y3fa6}But suppose I found an ambitious young captain - perhaps someone like your good self, someone who needed to sway a crowd or inspire soldiers at some point. I reckon I could travel with that captain - sharing all the battles and hardships of the road, of course - and perhaps teach them a bit of what I know.
{=5E6L8WcA}I might be able to hire someone like that.
{=LcihqCpu}My apologies, but that is not of interest to me.

{=Gyslal3Y}Splendid! Ah, but before I sign on... A few of the girls working in this tavern... Well, on the off-chance I've left one or two of them with child, I should leave a bit of coin with them before I go. {NPCPAYMENT}{GOLD_ICON} should cover it. Can you advance me that?
{=BIXQz5yS}If that's your last 'last request,' I suppose I can. Here's {NPCPAYMENT}{GOLD_ICON}.
{=s0TgECe7}Hello. Come any closer and I'll stick a knife in your belly, but if you remain where you are, I see no reason not to have a pleasant chat.
{=ziu66P84}I'll stand where I am. So, why so friendly a greeting?
{=clatEXV2}I'm backing away now, lady. Good day to you.

{=2fa1Ai55}Well, there was a time when I was less wary of strangers, but I've learned since that many of those who approach me in an inn or on the road have unworthy motives. It's a bit of a tale, but I will tell you if you're interested.

{=DdYimYLm}I had a bit of a protected upbringing, you see. I am a great-niece of Aldric, lord of Sarghert. My father died in his wars, but I was considered a member of his household, and I was to be married to a horseman in his retinue. Alas, I fell in love with one of the common soldiers. He was high-spirited, handsome - the kind of boy who imagined the evils of this world could never touch him.
{=TGYJUUn0}Go on.
{=D33fIGQe}Never mind.

{=Jk83lyZl}I fled Sarghert. In a tavern in Bostrum, I found myself a surgeon who agreed to take me on as apprentice. I followed the empire's armies, and I found that my knowledge learned in the barracks of Sarghert had a use. I became a surgeon's apprentice, removing arrows from ribcages or trepanning a skull.
{=jb3TXFa9}A sad tale, my dear, but Calradia is full of them. Good day.
{=a6Yqb6nY}I am.
{=WYri5sav}Hello, stranger. 'The cat walks on silent paws.'
{=xxaOegyt}Uh, 'but carries a large bird in its mouth'?
{=FKMaPDMy}You must have me confused with someone else.
{=VDssJwd4}Nice try, stranger. That's not the other half of the callword. But you don't look like the city watch, so I'm going to take a little risk here and ask you something.
{=08SDOFly}Are you heading out of town? I've been here for three days waiting for my contact to show up, but I don't think he will. I suspect that I might have drawn a bit of attention to myself.
{=rmX5ufHr}I might be heading out of town. Tell me a little more about yourself.
{=ySwWQmYW}Then the last thing I want, my lady, is to be seen talking to you.
{=aGRXxufp}As you can guess, I'm a smuggler. And a good one, at that.
{=pyz3ruTU}Well, that's upfront of you to tell me that. What skills would you bring to my company?

{=RsCPQ167}My parents moved to Baravenus as refugees from Sturgian raids, and I started off doing errands for the merchants. Some of them like to get merchandise in or out of the city without going through the gate - they don't care for paying tariffs, perhaps, or maybe the item's original owner is out looking for it.

{=1EKWnCBa}So, in time, I made contacts in towns up and down the western half of Calradia. Sometimes it's a guard who's not averse to a little extra cash. Sometimes there's a washerwoman who'll let down a rope over the walls at night. Is that the knowledge that's useful to you?
{=fV5Icuc4}That is useful. Can you also fight?
{=xpGLd7Co}I'm afraid not, my lady. You'd best leave now.

{=dDt6c7kr}Oh, have no fear. I don't swat down armies like flies but I can probably take them down one or two villains at a time, if need be. There is, however, a small matter of asking you for - {NPCPAYMENT}{GOLD_ICON}. I have run up a bit of a tab at this tavern, and I may need to use it again at some point.
{=lJkybj3d}Hello, wanderer. Care to join me for a cup of wine?
{=AGBkVF4G}No harm in that, I suppose. So. Tell me about yourself.
{=C6GmacOA}I am otherwise occupied, sir.

{=vl7wgzIg}I am Tabur son of Alqan. You do not recognize the name? Well, perhaps we move in different circles. Any connoisseur of dinner parties, wine, courtesans, and poetry would doubtless have heard of me.

{=dU3II3Lv}Why, just the other evening I was attending a soiree in this very town, and the host told me that I was truly an ornament among guests, who brought more light to his party than a hundred lanterns, more music than a hundred lutes. It was with great sorrow, he said, that he must call his guards on me, because by some oversight I had not been invited and thus in eating his food I was, by a legal technicality, a thief.
{=tEw3TwnM}How blunt of him! What happened next?
{=3tsuUf0H}And he was right to say that! Good day. sir.

{=nEHOUdf8}I confess that this is not the first time something like this has happened to me. Hosts can be such sticklers about their guest lists. But it has left me at a bit of an impasse, as I should probably leave this town sooner rather than later.
{=TMLpc1mq}So you live by sneaking into other men's dinner parties, I see. But it sounds like you have a useful set of skills.
{=9yWwSi7g}You sound like trouble, sir. Good day.

{=sQgZR0dA}My friend, why should a man not eat the finest food off of golden plates, if he has the wit to do so? Although I confess I am growing a bit jaded of it all, and perhaps would enjoy a change of pace.

{=swaLbjD1}More importantly, I really should be moving on. I don't suppose you might be in the market for my talents and knowledge? I know a back door into every city in the eastern half of Calradia, or the right guard to bribe.
{=blY5YhSL}Very well. That could come in handy. I can offer you a place in my company.
{=kn76Y4yi}I have no golden plates for you to dine off. I doubt you'd last long with us. Good day to you.

{=n5y4faSu}Splendid! I must ask you, however, for a small downpayment of {NPCPAYMENT}{GOLD_ICON}. I have a debt that I had hoped to repay with some silverware, but I encountered some difficulties with that.
{=EmTojvwy}Do you know who I am, traveler?
{=hcMJen3F}No, can't say that I do. So who are you?
{=Ac8dPtH8}I do not know, nor do I care to.

{=KU1nXWTK}The searing gravel plain knows me, as do the rippling sands and the shadowed canyon. I have faced the scouring sandstorm, the rushing flood, the killing heat of noontime, and they have all said to me, 'Pass safely, brother.'
{=iBoVz4wv}I am Lath, prince of the wastelands, lord of solitude, master of emptiness. If you wish to know my other names, you may ask my kinsmen, the leopard, the hyena and the gazelle.
{=SPp4OsPO}Lath is fine. No need to speak to the hyenas. What do you do?
{=vT1fdgss}Master of empty talk, rather. Good day, sir.
{=Xi0A9Bb8}However, although the desert is bountiful, horses and steel must be bought with silver. So, I wish to inform you, my services are for hire.
{=qEsEzBME}Hmm. I could be interested. What can you offer me?
{=OGNIl4xM}I have no interest in your services.
{=zbji14tF}I am a pathfinder and a scout.
{=JZU9vtFg}If you wish to pass swiftly through the desert, to find shelters to hide from your foes, to find water where others find only dust and death, then I am your man.
{=gMXTUU1O}Very well, I can offer you a place in my company.
{=gkOfyxfd}Perhaps at a later date.
{=o7gJN0Kk}You will not regret your decision. One thing I must ask - before riding out, I need a new bridle and saddle. An advance of {NPCPAYMENT}{GOLD_ICON} should suffice.

{=kpD07Ib2}There is only one thing that I want to hear from anyone right now: that the news I have heard is false. That the warehouse in Makeb which I stored my pepper did not catch fire, and that I have not lost my fortune.
{=bwb4nB4m} You invested your whole fortune in a single cargo of pepper?
{=mjiaqseL}I've heard bad luck is contagious. Good-bye.
{=UhEt737M}I did. Well, it was a risk - but a calculated one. If you are willing to listen to my story, I would welcome the chance to unburden my sorrows.

{=Gepa1szA}My father was a merchant. When he died, he left his children a small inheritance. Most went to my brothers. They headed east, to the lands of the Padishah, leaving me in charge of our interests in Calradia. For me to step into my father's shoes, and be treated as an equal by other merchants, I knew I had to make a lot of money in a short time or they would elbow me out of the market.

{=yYHCwEeo}Even now I feel I made a wise choice to buy the pepper -- wise, but unlucky. Such is fortune! Had I not seized this opportunity, other merchants would have mocked me, a woman too timid to succeed in a man's trade. Now they tut-tut, a rash woman who lacked a man's judgment.
{=SVOylcqx}If you know your way around caravans, I may have some work for you.
{=nYAU0zNC}A wise king once said: I ask only of my generals that they be lucky. Good day, madame.

{=znWhtJxt}I do indeed. I pay attention to packing and loading in particular. It is a fine art, one which determines how fast a beast of burden can move, whether a caravan makes good time or is forever pausing to pick up a spilled load.
{=jEtASKar}If you carry many supplies, I can promise you -- as much as anyone can promise anything, in this uncertain world -- that I will repay my salary many times over.
{=odwyvxY1}Splendid. I have every confidence in you.
{=nNFSLJ2A}That is too specialized a skill, my lady. Good-bye.
{=N91Wnhht}There is only one thing I must ask. I would like to leave this town with clean balance books. I would like to settle all my debts. An advance of {NPCPAYMENT}{GOLD_ICON} should be enough.
{=unbf7266}I'm here to drink, not to talk, so whatever it you have to say, I'd advise you to say it to someone else. Unless, that is, you have a fight that needs fighting.
{=Y7elloP2}Uh, well, I might. Why would you want to fight for me?
{=h4QlH7wG}If I did, I'd be inclined to seek the services of someone less foul-tempered.
{=nbbn0HaV}Why? I'll tell you why.

{=wd4BBrTY}Because I've drunk my way through all the silver in my pocket, and I'm thirsty again. Because it's been a too long since I swung a sword, and my arm's a bit itchy. Because if you don't kill a man every few weeks, people forget what you're about. There. You need only one reason, and I just give you three.
{=TnVIWrof}You sound like you have the right attitude. Tell me more about yourself.
{=teLnMBXG}I like my men to be aggressive, but there are limits. Good-day, sir.
{=XHCxDciV}I hope I've made it clear to you what I'm about.
{=ovC1Sdix}Very well. One thing I can promise you is a lot of fighting.
{=bRRi5GiL}Here's my conditions: I expect to be paid well, and I don't kill men who don't fight back.
{=UYmAp92Q}In return, I promise you I'll be first into every battle. I also yell a lot. You'll find it encourages the others. Do we have a deal?
{=c1vQQwKv}Sure. I suppose we do.
{=QQN2906x}Let me think about this a bit.
{=7WrfCwuL}Good. I'm going to want from you {NPCPAYMENT}{GOLD_ICON} up front. Like I say, I'm a thirsty man.
{=8ya4JQyc}Greetings, stranger. You must be a stranger here, for few born here would speak to me.
{=lDVo9y0g}And why is that? What's your story?
{=dZFO1esU}They must know something I do not. Good day, my lady.

{=05P003ev}When I was a girl, I chose to be a shieldmaiden, and accompanied my brothers on their raids. When I came of age, I was pursued by one of the finest warriors in our valley. All the girls dreamed of marrying him. I agreed to marry him on condition that he never tried to prevent me from going to war, and this pledge he made.

{=ff0uDowD}Soon into our marriage he lost his ardor for me, and began to regret his pledge. When I sought to go raiding, he scowled and demanded that I stay home and give him children. He became jealous. When I cursed him back, he struck me with the flat of his sword. One day, in the marketplace, before all the people of our village, he accused me of lying with anyone who crossed my path, man or woman. I struck him. By the laws of our people he had not given me any grounds for divorce, so I demanded a fight to the death instead.
{=9HTt6P0U}That is one solution to a bad marriage. Did you go through with this plan?
{=jxZSkF76}You dueled your husband? Heavens avert all evil. I have heard enough.
{=yczuEk0C} He fought to kill, but I was faster, and I slew him. I feel no regret. Let any man who imagines he can treat a shieldmaiden like chattel consider his fate.
{=5Y5mxebR}Well, it sounds like you can fight, at least. Do you need employment?
{=0b8vP1ba}You soiled the sacred tradition of marriage! You soiled it with blood!
{=4m5w7HIP}If you have a company-in-arms, and you vow to honor your word and your debts, I am willing to serve in it.
{=zsXbMbnc}I have one, and I can do that.
{=QQN2906x}Let me think about this a bit.
{=s0Yanm4a}Very good. I would ask for {NPCPAYMENT}{GOLD_ICON} up front. I kill those who cheat me, and then afterwards it can be hard to collect payment.
{=fY7gnK3p}Greetings - hello - if you don't mind ... - got a minute?
{=jaLG4P9R}I might. What is it?
{=EPj9FwBy}Look, I'm very sorry to trouble you, but - I notice you seem to be a wanderer. A fighter, like - a mercenary or something. I'd like to join you.
{=sRxN3IyF}Know before you speak to me, that I am under a curse.
{=AXy281gD}What sort of curse?
{=6Rqc8OOc}Heavens protect us from evil! Go away! Go away!

{=77kuaIpz}When I was just a baby, a woman came to my father's hall, a woman who was said to be able to speak to the Otherworld. When she saw me, she told him that she saw the mark of the faeries upon me. She performed a divination, and said she had learned that I was to be a prank played on mankind: I should grow up to be a great beauty, but that any man who resolves to marry me shall die.

{=vm7V0Il5}Well, he did not believe in such things, so he laughed, tossed her a few coins, and sent her on her way. I grew up. When my first suitor was skewered by a spear in battle, I grieved, but thought little of it. When my second suitor passed of a fever, I was unnerved. When my third suitor was thrown from his horse on a hunt, I knew I must do something.
{=u8N37fgb}A tragic story, my lady. Please continue.
{=bUZATRQM}Faeries? I have no time for such tales.
{=7cVb7eda}It is hard to find a lord who will take me in his retinue, as men tend to fear me. So opportunities for work are few and far between.
{=pQfiRC55}I'll take anyone, faerie-marked or not, if they can hold a place in a battle-line.
{=1af4enJo}Mm... I agree with the lords who don't like to mess with the Otherworld.
{=g4cOvMnT}Just be sure you tell your men of the curse upon me, as I would not wish to take anyone else's life, if it can be avoided.
{=vzfZyIfy}Certainly. A very sensible precaution.
{=nagec3c3}Oh... Hm... Look, warriors can be a bit credulous... Maybe we should give this a pass.
{=7BMEqR9P}Good. I would merely ask from you an advance of {NPCPAYMENT}{GOLD_ICON}, to settle all affairs, and I shall join you.
{=a1qmkOxD}Who are you? What do you want?
{=22Wl39Zg}I merely meant to toast your health. As strangers sometimes do in taverns, without meaning any harm.
{=D33fIGQe}Never mind.
{=bx0dzZTU}Ah. I am sorry. It has been long since I spoke with other men. And I am a bit drunk... Look, let me tell you my story.

{=bXfBBvzl}I'm from the fen Dairl. We're not one of the biggest clans of Battania, but we're good fighters.
